results.title: Overtaking and being overtaken
results.brief_description:
Episode number 6 of Series “The Skills of Defensive Driving”.
Suggests ways in which the defensive driver can overtake and how to react to being overtaken. Shows the pitfalls leading to accidents while overtaking and being overtaken. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: The Opening of Canberra, Australia's capital city
results.brief_description: Shows the arrival of the Duke and Duchess of York at Parliament House. They are welcomed by the Governor-General, Lord Stonehaven and the Prime Minister, Mr. S.M. Bruce. The guard of honour is inspected and the Royal visitors are escorted into the Senate Chamber. There are also scenes of a parade of 3,000 troops and a body of returned soldiers.

results.title: One man's war
results.creator_credit: Tom Gurr, Jack S. Allan and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: Made to encourage a better understanding of the meaning of the war in Korea. The film conveys impressions of the war as experienced by an Australian infantryman. Photographed on the Australian troopship, in Japan and on the South Korean battlefields.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Tom Gurr, Jack S. Allan and Australian National Film Board

results.title: Nullarbor hideout
results.creator_credit: Australian Children's Television Foundation, Tim Burstall, John Martin-Jones and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: The adventures of a group of children living at Cook on the Nullarbor Plain. They discover a swimming pool in a limestone cave and make the cave their hide-out. The children become involved with kangaroo shooters who are wanted by police for car stealing. Cast includes Tom Burstall, Betty Burstall, David Crocker, Frances Hatham, Marcus Skipper.

results.title: Not to lose you my language: bilingual education in the Northern Territory = Wangka walytjalampa titu ngaranytjaku
results.creator_credit: Greg Reading, Malcolm Otton, Timothy Read and Film Australia
results.brief_description: Gives an impression of the day-to-day operation of the Aboriginal bilingual program in three widely separated schools in the Northern Territory: Milingimbi, Yuendumu and the outstation of Yayayi.

results.title: North to the sun
results.creator_credit: John Martin-Jones and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: The story of the development of the rich tropical area around Cairns in the northern parts of Queensland. Shows the primary industries of the region including timber, maize and tobacco; its potentialities for development and its attraction as a homeland for newcomers.

results.title: New decimal coin designs
results.brief_description: Designs for Australia’s six new decimal coins prepared by local designer Stuart Devlin, are presented by the Federal Treasurer, Mr. Harold Holt, and a member of the advisory panel on design Mr. Hal Missingham, who worked closely with the designer and helped solve technical problems. The coins feature seven of Australia’s unique fauna- the spiny anteater, lyre-bird, frilled lizard, feather-tailed glider, platypus, kangaroo and emu.
